article.description: Antonio Lofton's 23 points paced Chicago State to an 88-69 victory over Trinity, Ill., on Tuesday night.
article.headline: Antonio Lofton lifts Chicago State to win against Trinity
article.linkText: Lofton lifts Chicago State to win against Trinity
article.story: CHICAGO -- Antonio Lofton's 23 points paced Chicago State to an 88-69 victory over Trinity, Ill., on Tuesday night. Lofton made 7 of his 8 shots from the floor and all nine of his free throws for the Cougars (3-9), who broke a five-game losing streak. He also had a team-best eight rebounds. Carl Montgomery supplied 15 points, and Hajji Martin added 13. Patrick Atkins led the NAIA Trojans (7-8) with 16 points and eight rebounds. Ignas Verbus scored 13 points and had seven rebounds and four blocked shots. Chicago State outrebounded Trinity 55-38 and had 54 points in the paint to the Trojans' 18. The Cougars shot 46.9 percent (33 of 71) while holding the Trojans to 31.3 percent (20 of 64). Neither team shot well from 3-point range. Trinity went 7-for-29, and Chicago State was at 3-for-14. The Cougars led 44-34 at halftime.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
